alert.note: Alert for Southwest (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 29 at 6:16AM ADT until October 30 at 9:00AM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Puerto Rico and Virgin Islands, including the following areas, in Puerto Rico, Central Interior, Culebra, Eastern Interior, Mayaguez and Vicinity, North Central, Northeast, Northwest, Ponce and Vicinity, San Juan and Vicinity, Southeast, Southwest, Vieques, and Western Interior. In Virgin Islands, St Croix and St.Thomas...St. John...and Adjacent Islands. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Plenty of tropical moisture and favorable upper-level conditions will bring periods of showers and thunderstorms across the local islands through at least Tuesday. However, wet conditions are possible Wednesday through Friday next week. Based on the most recent guidance, scattered to numerous showers and isolated thunderstorms will continue today across the forecast area. The areas most likely to receive the highest rainfall accumulations are the interior, eastern and southern sections of Puerto Rico as well as the US Virgin Islands. In these areas, there is the potential for event-based rainfall totals of 3-6 inches with higher amounts up to 8 inches through at least Tuesday. Elsewhere across Puerto Rico, rainfall totals of 3-5 inches are possible. There is an elevated risk for flooding of urban areas,roads and small streams. Life threatening flash flooding and mudslides are possible as well. Some rivers will likely overflow their banks. As a result the Flash Flood Watch is in effect through at least Monday morning. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
